page.title: 01DESCRIPTION OF OUR AREA
page.content: Flat gently sloping land rising from sea level to 60m Gravelly soils and clay deposits.Arable-mainly wheat, barley,oil seed rape.No extensive inland water only ,wells,ponds and small brooks.Small areas of wood.Some fruit farming.Quiet rural area, two villages,Woodham Walter and Woodham Mortimer with one major public bus service.Divided by major road A414 from Maldon to Chelmsford.Also quiet lanes without footpaths.Scattered population,long standing families plus shifting commuters. Property ranges from 15th Century to modern day. Limited industry- Research Station into Sugar beet, Electronic Research,Development and manufacture and Sand and Gravel Extractable industry.Recreational activities are outdoors and Public houses.There is an absence of most Social Services.
